intro: Henriettella tobagensis, commonly known as the Togabensis bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Tobago. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often near streams or in forest undergrowth. Henriettella tobagensis has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of flowers during the warmer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
